metadata.Title: CVE-2023-40397 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description:
The issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in macOSVentura 13.5. A remote attacker may be able to cause arbitrary javascriptcode execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-40397` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.40.5-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.1 - 2.40.5-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-6.0 - 2.40.5-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
gir1.2-webkit-6.0 - 2.40.5-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.40.5-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.1 - 2.40.5-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.40.5-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.40.5-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.1-0 - 2.40.5-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-6.0-1 - 2.40.5-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.40.5-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0 - 2.40.5-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
libwebkitgtk-6.0-4 - 2.40.5-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.40.5-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.40.5-0ubuntu0.23.04.1').
qtwebkit-opensource-src package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
